comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Arthur von Briesen (1843-1920), a New York City lawyer and philanthropist. Von Briesen, a German-American patent lawyer, served as President of the Legal Aid Society of New York (1889-1916), and as president of the Alliance of Legal Aid Societies of America. (findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/MC034) The site of Von Briesen Park, Staten Island was the former estate of Arthur von Briesen. (www.5borohistory.com/2012/11/shore-acres-staten-island.html)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: A February 25, 1916 article reported that he stepped down as head of the Legal Aid Society because his German name and sympathies were harming the organization. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0616FD345C1373...

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks B-59 for finding his first name. We will add it to our catalog record.
